intro: Erigerodes mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican erigeron, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy surfaces, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments.
